key_takeaways: Solution: Only show up to networking events with intention and when you actually want to be there (Difficulty: intermediate)
Solution: Eliminate the word 'should' from commitments and distinguish between what you have to do vs think yo (Difficulty: intermediate)
Growth Tactic: Host intentional networking events without expensive overhead (Channel: community)
Strategy: Event hosting without overthinking - you don't need sponsors, open bar, or expensive setups
Strategy: Optimize for happiness in business and life decisions

market_gaps.title: Ineffective networking through traditional events
market_gaps.solution_approach: Only show up to networking events with intention and when you actually want to be there

market_gaps.title: Taking on commitments you don't want
market_gaps.solution_approach: Eliminate the word 'should' from commitments and distinguish between what you have to do vs think yo

trend_opportunities.title: Shift away from traditional networking toward intentional relationship building
trend_opportunities.opportunity: creating more meaningful, goal-oriented networking experiences

comment_derived_trends.trend: Reframing networking conversations from transactional to relationship-focused
comment_derived_trends.business_implication: Opportunity to develop networking training or frameworks that help people shift from traditional self-promotion to relationship-building approaches

practical_next_steps: Review mistakes to avoid and create prevention checklist
